intro: Matelea viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a somewhat hairy texture. Matelea viridiflora is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
